User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the fraud detection system.

Transaction.title: Transaction
Transaction.description: Represents a simulated or real credit card transaction.

merchantDetails.description: Details of the merchant involved in the transaction.

cardNumber.description: The credit card number used for the transaction.

fraudulent.description: Indicates whether the transaction is predicted as fraudulent.

confidenceScore.description: Confidence score of the fraud prediction (0-1).

definition.description: Stores transaction data. Path-based ownership: only the user {userId} can access transactions in this subcollection.

params.name: userId
params.description: Unique identifier for the user who owns the transaction.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to support a fraud detection system with user accounts and transaction tracking. It prioritizes security, scalability, and debuggability. Authorization Independence is achieved by leveraging path-based ownership for transactions, ensuring that each transaction is directly associated with a user's document. This eliminates the need for complex `get()` calls in security rules to determine ownership. Structural Segregation is maintained by placing all transactions for a user within a subcollection of their user document, ensuring that all documents within the `/users/{userId}/transactions` collection share the same security requirements. This also enforces the `User 1:N Transaction` relationship. The design supports the required QAPs by using path-based ownership and storing each user's transactions in the subcollection `/users/{userId}/transactions`. This structure makes it straightforward to write security rules that allow only the authenticated user to access their own transactions.
